Praise be to Allah, The Maintainer (Al-Qa'im) over every soul (Nafs) with what it has earned, The Watcher (Ar-Raqib) over every limb with what it has committed, The Knower (Al-Mutali') of the secrets of the hearts (Qulub) when they whisper, The Reckoner (Al-Hasib) over the thoughts of His servants when they stir, He from Whose knowledge does not escape the weight of an atom (mithqal dharrah) in the heavens and the earth, whether it moves or remains still, The Accountant (Al-Muhasib) over the smallest speck (an-naqir) and the tiniest particle (al-qitmir) and the little and the much of deeds, even if hidden, The Bestower of favor (Al-Mutafaddil) by accepting the obedience (ta'at) of the servants even if small, The Extender of pardon (Al-Mutawalli) by forgiving their sins even if many, and He only accounts them so that every soul (Nafs) may know what it has brought forth and look at what it has sent ahead and left behind, so it knows that were it not for its adherence to vigilance (muraqabah) and accounting (muhasabah) in this world, it would be exposed on the plain of resurrection and perish, and after striving (mujahadah) and accounting (muhasabah) and vigilance (muraqabah), were it not for His grace (fadl) by accepting its paltry merchandise, it would fail and lose. So glory be to Him whose blessing (ni'mah) has encompassed all the servants and whose mercy (rahmah) has embraced and overwhelmed the creatures in this world and the hereafter and flooded, so by the breaths of His grace (fadl) the hearts (Qulub) expanded for faith (iman) and became open, and by the blessing of His enabling success (tawfiq) the limbs became bound to acts of worship (ibadat) and disciplined, and by His good guidance (hidayah) the darknesses of ignorance (jahl) cleared from the hearts (Qulub) and dispersed, and by His support (ta'yid) and help (nusrah) the schemes of Satan (Shaytan) were cut off and repelled, and by His gentle care (lutf 'inayah) the scale of good deeds (hasanat) tips when it becomes heavy, and by His facilitation (taysir) what was facilitated from acts of obedience (ta'at) was facilitated, so from Him is the giving and the recompense and the distancing and the bringing near and the making happy and the making wretched, and prayers and peace be upon Muhammad, the master of the prophets, and upon his family, the masters of the chosen ones, and upon his companions, the leaders of the pious. After this, Allah the Exalted has said: 'And We will set up the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul (Nafs) will be wronged at all, and even if it be the weight of an atom (mithqal dharrah), We will bring it forth, and sufficient are We as reckoners.'

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Love, Longing, and Intimacy
As for knowledge: where is the knowledge of the first and the last compared to the knowledge of Allah the Exalted which encompasses everything with an encompassing that is beyond limit, such that not even the weight of an atom in the heavens or in the earth escapes Him? And He addressed all creation, saying, the Mighty and Majestic: "And you have not been given of knowledge except a little." Rather, if the people of the earth and the sky were to gather to encompass His knowledge and wisdom in the details of the creation of an ant or a mosquito, they would not attain a tenth of a tenth of that. "And they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except by what He wills." And the small amount that all creatures know, they know it by His teaching, as Allah the Exalted said: "He created man, He taught him the clear expression." So if the beauty and nobility of the knower is a beloved matter, and it is in itself an adornment and perfection attributed to him, then it is not fitting to be loved for this reason except Allah the Exalted.

a.g: And when We decreed for Solomon death, nothing indicated to the jinn his death except a creature of the earth eating his staff. But when he fell, it became clear to the jinn that if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in humiliating punishment.

There was for [the tribe of] Saba' in their dwelling place a sign: two [fields of] gardens on the right and on the left. [They were told], "Eat from the provisions of your Lord and be grateful to Him. A good land [have you], and a forgiving Lord."
But they turned away [refusing], so We sent upon them the flood of the dam, and We replaced their two [fields of] gardens with gardens of bitter fruit, tamarisks and something of sparse lote trees.
[By] that We repaid them because they disbelieved. And do We [thus] repay except the ungrateful?

And We placed between them and the cities which We had blessed [many] visible cities. And We determined between them the [distances of] journey, [saying], "Travel between them by night or day in safety."

But [insolently] they said, "Our Lord, lengthen the distance between our journeys," and wronged themselves, so We made them narrations and dispersed them in total dispersion. Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.
And Iblees had already confirmed through them his assumption, so they followed him, except for a party of believers.
And he had over them no authority except [it was decreed] that We might make evident who believes in the Hereafter from who is thereof in doubt. And your Lord, over all things, is Guardian.

Say, [O Muhammad], "Invoke those you claim [as deities] besides Allah." They do not possess an atom's weight [of ability] in the heavens or on the earth, and they do not have therein any partnership [with Him], nor is there for Him from among them any assistant.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Love, Longing, and Intimacy
The Subduer (Al-Qahhar) whose power does not let the necks of tyrants escape from His grasp, nor do the necks of emperors slip away from His dominance and might; The Eternal (Al-Azali) who has no beginning to His existence; The Everlasting (Al-Abadi) who has no end to His permanence; The Necessary Existent (Al-Wajib al-Wujud) around whose presence the possibility of non-existence does not hover; The Self-Subsisting (Al-Qayyum) who subsists by Himself and through whom every existent subsists; The Compeller of the heavens and the earth; The Creator of inanimate objects, animals, and plants; The One Alone in might and sovereignty (Al-Jabarut), and The Unique in dominion and kingdom (Al-Malakut); Possessor of grace, majesty, splendor, beauty, power, and perfection; He whose majesty bewilders intellects in knowing Him and whose description silences tongues; He for whom the perfection of the knowers' (Al-Arifin) knowledge is the acknowledgment of incapacity to know Him, and the ultimate of the prophets' prophethood is the admission of inadequacy in describing Him, as the master of the prophets (peace and blessings of God be upon him and upon them all) said: 'I cannot enumerate praise upon You; You are as You have praised Yourself.' [15] And the master of the truthful ones (may God be pleased with him) said: 'Incapacity to grasp perception is perception.' Glory be to Him who did not make for the creation a way to know Him except through incapacity to know Him. So I wonder, who denies the possibility of loving God (Allah) in reality and makes it metaphorical? Does he deny that these attributes are from the attributes of beauty and praiseworthiness and the descriptions of perfection and beauties? Does he deny that God is described by them or deny that perfection is beloved? If perfection is beloved, then God is absolute perfection, so how can He not be beloved? Then He said: 'Say: Call upon those whom you claim besides God; they do not possess an atom's weight in the heavens nor in the earth, nor have they any partnership in them, nor has He among them any supporter.' [Saba': 22], thus clarifying that what is other than Him does not possess an atom's weight in the heavens nor in the earth, so how can it have perfection?

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Condemnation of Pride and Conceit
If you say: Indeed, He (peace be upon him) said after his statement to Fatimah and Safiyyah, "I cannot avail you anything from Allah except that you have kinship ties which I will maintain with their due," and he (peace and blessings be upon him) said, "Do you hope for Salim's intercession and not hope for it the sons of Abd al-Muttalib?" So does that indicate that he will specialize his relatives with intercession? Then know that every Muslim is awaiting the intercession of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), and the relative is also worthy of hoping for it, but on the condition that he fears Allah that He may become angry with him, for if He becomes angry with him, then He does not permit anyone in his intercession, because sins are divided into that which necessitates wrath, so intercession is not permitted for him, and into that which is forgiven due to intercession, like sins with the kings of the world, for every person of status with the king cannot intercede in that upon which the king's anger has intensified. So among sins is that from which intercession does not save, and about it is the expression by His saying, the Most High, "Nor do they intercede except for whom He approves," and by His saying, "Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission?" and by His saying, "And intercession does not benefit with Him except for whom He permits," and by His saying, "So their intercession will not benefit them." And if sins are divided into that in which intercession is made and into that in which intercession is not made, then fear and apprehension are obligatory without doubt. And if there were a sin in which intercession is accepted, He would not have commanded the Quraysh with obedience, and the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) would not have prohibited Fatimah (may Allah be pleased with her) from disobedience, and He would have permitted her to follow desires to complete her self (Nafs) in this world, then intercede for her in the Hereafter to complete her self (Nafs) in the Hereafter. So immersion in sins and abandoning piety (Taqwa) relying on the hope of intercession resembles the immersion of the sick person in his desires depending on a skilled doctor who is close and compassionate like a father or brother or other, and that is ignorance because the effort of the doctor, his diligence, and his skill benefit in removing some illnesses, not all of them. So it is not permissible to abandon precaution absolutely relying on mere medicine, rather the doctor has an effect in general but in mild illnesses and when the balance of temperament (Mizaj) predominates. Thus, you should understand the care of intercessors from the prophets and the righteous for relatives and strangers, for it is certainly like that, and that does not remove fear and caution, and how can it remove when the best of creation after the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) are his companions, and they used to wish they were beasts out of fear of the Hereafter with the perfection of their piety (Taqwa), the goodness of their deeds, the purity of their hearts (Qulub), and what they heard from the promise of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) to them of Paradise.

And the differing composition of its limbs are wonders that increase upon wonders in its resurrection and restoration, so how can one deny that from the power (Qudrah) of Allah the Exalted and His wisdom who witnesses that in His creation and power? If there is weakness in your faith (Iman), then strengthen the faith (Iman) by looking at the first creation, for the second is like it and easier than it. And if you are strong in faith (Iman) in it, then make your heart (Qalb) feel those fears and dangers, and increase in it contemplation (Tafakkur) and consideration (I'tibar) to strip from your heart (Qalb) comfort and settlement, so you busy yourself with preparing for the presentation before the Almighty (Al-Jabbar). And contemplate first in what strikes the hearing of the inhabitants of the graves from the intensity of the blowing of the Trumpet (As-Sur), for it is a single shout by which the graves split open from the heads of the dead, and they rise up all at once. So imagine yourself having leapt up, your face changed, your body dusty from your scalp to your feet from the dust of your grave, stunned from the intensity of the blow, your eye fixed toward the call. And the creation has risen up in one uprising from the graves in which their tribulation (Bala') has been prolonged, and alarm and terror have agitated them, added to what they had of sorrows and griefs and intense waiting for the outcome of the matter, as the Exalted said: 'And the Trumpet (As-Sur) will be blown, and all who are in the heavens and all who are on the earth will fall dead except whom Allah wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing, looking on.' And the Exalted said: 'And when the Horn (An-Naqur) is blown, that Day will be a difficult day for the disbelievers; not easy.' And the Exalted said: 'And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?" They do not await except one blast which will seize them while they are disputing. And they will not be able to make a testament, nor to their people will they return. And the Horn (As-Sur) will be blown; and at once from the graves to their Lord they will hasten. They will say, "O woe to us! Who has raised us from our sleeping place? This is what the Most Merciful had promised, and the messengers told the truth."' So if there were not before the dead except the terror of that blowing, it would be worthy of being guarded against, for it is a blowing and a shout by which those in the heavens and the earth are struck dead, meaning they die by it except whom Allah wills, and that is some of the angels. And for that reason, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'How can I be at ease when the possessor of the Trumpet (As-Sur) has taken the horn (Al-Qarn) in his mouth, lowered his forehead, and inclined his ear, waiting for when he will be commanded to blow?' Maqatil said: The Trumpet (As-Sur) is the horn (Al-Qarn), and that is because Israfil (upon him be peace) has placed his mouth on the horn (Al-Qarn) like the form of a trumpet, and the circle of the head of the horn (Al-Qarn) is like the expanse of the heavens and the earth, and he is fixing his gaze toward the Throne (Al-'Arsh), waiting for when he will be commanded to blow the first blowing. And when he blows, those in the heavens and the earth are struck dead, meaning every animal dies from the intensity of the alarm except whom Allah wills, and that is Jibril, Mika'il, Israfil, and the Angel of Death (Malak al-Mawt). Then the Angel of Death (Malak al-Mawt) is commanded to take the soul (Ruh) of Jibril, then the soul (Ruh) of Mika'il, then the soul (Ruh) of Israfil, then the Angel of Death (Malak al-Mawt) is commanded and he dies. Then the creation remains after the first blowing in the Barzakh for forty years, then Allah the Exalted revives Israfil and commands.

Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "If not for you, we would have been believers."

And the worst type of arrogance (Kibr) is what prevents from benefiting from knowledge and accepting the truth (Haqq) and submitting to it, and in it have come the verses which contain censure of arrogance (Kibr) and the arrogant ones. Allah the Exalted said: "And the angels are stretching forth their hands" to His saying "and you were arrogant (Tastakbirun) about His signs." Then He said: "Enter the gates of Hell, abiding eternally therein, and wretched is the residence of the arrogant (Mutakabirin)." Then He informed that the most severely punished people of the Fire are the most insolent (Atiyyan) against Allah the Exalted, so He said: "Then We will surely extract from every faction those of them who were most insolent (Atiyyan) against the Most Merciful." And He the Exalted said: "So those who do not believe in the Hereafter - their hearts are denying and they are arrogant (Mustakbirun)." And He the Mighty and Majestic said: "Those who were oppressed (Mustad'afun) say to those who were arrogant (Mustakbirun), 'If not for you, we would have been believers.'" And He the Exalted said: "Indeed, those who are arrogant (Yastakbirun) about My worship will enter Hell in humiliation." And He the Exalted said: "I will turn away from My signs those who are arrogant (Yatakabbarun) in the earth without right." It is said in the interpretation (Tafsir): I will lift the understanding of the Quran from their hearts (Qulub), and in some interpretations (Tafasir) I will veil their hearts (Qulub) from the dominion (Malakut). And Ibn Juraij said: I will turn them away from reflecting upon them and taking admonition from them.

Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "Rather, [it was your] conspiracy of night and day when you were ordering us to disbelieve in Allah and attribute to Him equals." But they will [all] confide regret when they see the punishment; and We will put shackles on the necks of those who disbelieved. Will they be recompensed except for what they used to do?
And We did not send into a city any warner except that its affluent said, "Indeed we, in that with which you were sent, are disbelievers."
And they said, "We are more [than the believers] in wealth and children, and we are not to be punished."

The sixth: Pride (Al-'Ujb) in the multitude of numbers from children and servants and young attendants and tribe and relatives and supporters and followers, as the disbelievers said: 'We are more in wealth and children' (Quran 34:35), and as the believers said on the day of Hunayn: 'We shall not be defeated today from fewness.' And its cure is what we mentioned regarding arrogance (Al-Kibr), which is that he should reflect upon his weakness and their weakness and that all of them are weak slaves ('Ibad 'Ujaza) who do not possess for themselves harm nor benefit. 'How many a small company has overcome a large company by permission of Allah' (Quran 2:249). Then how can he be proud of them when they will separate from him when he dies, so he is buried in his grave humbled, forsaken, aloneâ€”no household member accompanies him, nor child, nor relative, nor intimate friend, nor tribesmanâ€”so they deliver him to decay and snakes and scorpions and worms, and they avail him nothing at the time he is most in need of them. And likewise they flee from him on the Day of Resurrection (Yawm al-Qiyamah): 'The Day a man will flee from his brother and his mother and his father and his companion and his sons' (Quran 80:34-36), the verse. So what good is there in one who parts from you in your most severe states and flees from you? And how can you be proud of him when he does not benefit you in the grave and the Resurrection and on the Bridge (Al-Sirat) to your deeds and the favor of Allah the Exalted? So how do you rely on one who does not benefit you, and forget the favors of the One who possesses your benefit and your harm and your death and your life?

a.g: Say, "Indeed, my Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it], but most of the people do not know."

And it is not your wealth or your children that bring you nearer to Us in position, but it is [by being] one who has believed and done righteousness. For them there will be the double reward for what they did, and they will be in the upper chambers [of Paradise], safe [and secure].
And the ones who strive against Our verses to cause [them] failure - those will be brought into the punishment [to remain].

Say, "Indeed, my Lord extends provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts [it] for him. But whatever thing you spend [in His cause] - He will compensate it; and He is the best of providers."
And [mention] the Day when He will gather them all and then say to the angels, "Did these [people] used to worship you?"
They will say, "Exalted are You! You, [O Allah], are our benefactor not them. Rather, they used to worship the jinn; most of them were believers in them."
But today you do not hold for one another [the power of] benefit or harm, and We will say to those who wronged, "Taste the punishment of the Fire, which you used to deny."

And when our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, they say, "This is not but a man who wishes to avert you from that which your fathers were worshipping." And they say, "This is not except a lie invented." And those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them, "This is not but obvious magic."
And We had not given them any scriptures which they could study, and We had not sent to them before you, [O Muhammad], any warner.
And those before them denied, and the people of Makkah have not attained a tenth of what We had given them. But the former peoples denied My messengers, so how [terrible] was My reproach.

Say, "I only advise you of one [thing] - that you stand for Allah, [seeking truth] in pairs and individually, and then give thought." There is not in your companion any madness. He is only a warner to you before a severe punishment.
Say, "Whatever payment I might have asked of you - it is yours. My payment is only from Allah, and He is, over all things, Witness."
Say, "Indeed, my Lord projects the truth. Knower of the unseen."
Say, "The truth has come, and falsehood can neither begin [anything] nor repeat [it]."
Say, "If I should err, I would only err against myself. But if I am guided, it is by what my Lord reveals to me. Indeed, He is Hearing and near."
And if you could see when they are terrified but there is no escape, and they will be seized from a place nearby.
And they will [then] say, "We believe in it!" But how for them will be the taking [of faith] from a place far away?
And they had already disbelieved in it before and would assault the unseen from a place far away.
And prevention will be placed between them and what they desire, as was done with their kind before. Indeed, they were in disquieting denial.
